title: Is Muhammad Ali the greatest heavyweight boxer ever? - Quora

response.answer_text: well from what i have seen over the past half century with my own eyes, ide have to say without a shadow of a doubt, YES . he fought All and Everybody. Cant think of anybody that Ali did not fight when he was boxing.. Won against the best boxers at the time and it spanned into two decades, including the Golden Age as well. Lost a couple, but faced Everybody.. Nobody comes close. NoBody. Moore, Patterson, Liston, Williams, Frazier, Foreman, Norton.. I mean to add Lyle, Quarry, Foster, Folley, Ellis, Chuvalo, Bonavena and Shavers. .. Name anybody that has that in their resume. NONE. Nobody comes close. NOBODY.. Not even Sugar Ray Robinson Foreman was at the primest of his prime. . Liston just used Patterson as a mop twice. . Shavers was at his peak. . Jimmy Young was a masterful boxer who beat Foreman.. Ali faced All styles . All up and coming fighters. . All the Heavy Punchers, those that were feared and heavily favored to knock his ass out, he Beat. No catchweight, no rediculous stipulations, no 'home' arena and fans didn’t have to wait years before the fight to happen.. That's Greatness. If you were chosen by the Universe to take boxing to Levels it's never been taken before with hand speed, hand eye coordination, the best footwork of All, better than any Heavyweight that came before or after and made it possible to earn million dollar purses for All fighters today, then you are the Greatest without even having to debate .

His trash-talking would have made him even more popular and his popularity and the power to draw crowds for his matches and TV shows was phenomenal. Though he was a good boxer. Even the best when he was the champion, he is not the greatest of all boxers. There is no objective consensus as to who is the greatest boxer of all times. But certainly, M.
